04 Nov 2019, 15:53

Everyone is invited to draw an illustration for a historical sketch about Berdsk
15:53 11/04/2019 0

The Berdsk Museum presented the project “We illustrate the book of Leonid Fedotov“ City on Birdie ”.

November 3 throughout Berdsk, namely in all its cultural institutions, held the Night of the Arts. This action allowed the mass of citizens of all ages to join the theater, music, painting, history, creativity - in a word, art in all its manifestations.
A rich program was in all the halls of the Berd Museum of History and Art: there were guided tours of exhibitions, quests, book presentations, interactive venues, meetings with creative people and concerts. About one of the projects - “We illustrate the book of Leonid Fedotov“ City on Birdie ”, which was presented by the museum staff, said the head of the historical department Maxim Vasilenko.
The background is as follows. In 1976, Leonid Fedotov wrote the historical essay “City on Birdie”, in which he reflected the life of our city from the laying of the prison to the 70s of the last century. In parts, the essay was published in the Berdskiye Novosti newspaper, and was first published by the museum in a collection of articles and archival documents in 2016.
Now the museum staff decided to create and publish a separate edition of the essay by publishing it along with illustrations that will be drawn by the Berdians.
During the Night of Arts, everyone could take a questionnaire in the museum with an excerpt printed on it from an essay by Leonid Fedotov. It is to these pieces of text that it is proposed to draw pictures. In total, there will be 38 of them in the future book. However, all the works created for the project will be included in the museum exposition next year.
How to take part in the project?

Everyone can become participants.

To do this, you need to register at the museum until December 20 of this year. In addition, you can send an application for a passage by e-mail gorod_na_berdi@mail.ru. The finished illustration should be transferred to the museum before January 10, 2020.
